summary.long: Lamentations is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
How lonely sits the city
That was full of people!
She has become like a widow
Who was once great among the nations!
She who was a princess among the provinces
Has become a forced laborer!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The roads of Zion are in mourning
Because no one comes to the appointed feasts.
All her gates are desolate;
Her priests are groaning,
Her virgins are afflicted,
And she herself is bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In the days of her affliction and homelessness
Jerusalem remembers all her precious things
That were from the days of old,
When her people fell into the hand of the adversary
And no one helped her.
The adversaries saw her,
They mocked at her ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem sinned greatly,
Therefore she has become an unclean thing.
All who honored her despise her
Because they have seen her nakedness;
Even she herself groans and turns away.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The adversary has stretched out his hand
Over all her precious things,
For she has seen the nations enter her sanctuary,
The ones whom You commanded
That they should not enter into Your congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All her people groan seeking bread;
They have given their precious things for food
To restore their lives themselves.
“See, O Lord, and look,
For I am despised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is it nothing to all you who pass this way?
Look and see if there is any pain like my pain
Which was severely dealt out to me,
Which the Lord inflicted on the day of His fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion
With a cloud in His anger!
He has cast from heaven to earth
The glory of Israel,
And has not remembered His footstool
In the day of His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In fierce anger He has cut off
All the strength of Israel;
He has drawn back His right hand
From before the enemy.
And He has burned in Jacob like a flaming fire
Consuming round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has become like an enemy.
He has swallowed up Israel;
He has swallowed up all its palaces,
He has destroyed its strongholds
And multiplied in the daughter of Judah
Mourning and moaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He has violently treated His tabernacle like a garden booth;
He has destroyed His appointed meeting place.
The Lord has caused to be forgotten
The appointed feast and sabbath in Zion,
And He has despised king and priest
In the indignation of His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has rejected His altar,
He has abandoned His sanctuary;
He has delivered into the hand of the enemy
The walls of her palaces.
They have made a noise in the house of the Lord
As in the day of an appointed feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord determined to destroy
The wall of the daughter of Zion.
He has stretched out a line,
He has not restrained His hand from destroying,
And He has caused rampart and wall to lament;
They have languished together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her gates have sunk into the ground,
He has destroyed and broken her bars.
Her king and her princes are among the nations;
The law is no more.
Also, her prophets find
No vision from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The elders of the daughter of Zion
Sit on the ground, they are silent.
They have thrown dust on their heads;
They have girded themselves with sackcloth.
The virgins of Jerusalem
Have bowed their heads to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes fail because of tears,
My spirit is greatly troubled;
My heart is poured out on the earth
Because of the destruction of the daughter of my people,
When little ones and infants faint
In the streets of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say to their mothers,
“Where is grain and wine?”
As they faint like a wounded man
In the streets of the city,
As their life is poured out
On their mothers’ bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How shall I admonish you?
To what shall I compare you,
O daughter of Jerusalem?
To what shall I liken you as I comfort you,
O virgin daughter of Zion?
For your ruin is as vast as the sea;
Who can heal you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your prophets have seen for you
False and foolish visions;
And they have not exposed your iniquity
So as to restore you from captivity,
But they have seen for you false and misleading oracles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who pass along the way
Clap their hands in derision at you;
They hiss and shake their heads
At the daughter of Jerusalem,
“Is this the city of which they said,
‘The perfection of beauty,
A joy to all the earth’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart cried out to the Lord,
“O wall of the daughter of Zion,
Let your tears run down like a river day and night;
Give yourself no relief,
Let your eyes have no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Arise, cry aloud in the night
At the beginning of the night watches;
Pour out your heart like water
Before the presence of the Lord;
Lift up your hands to Him
For the life of your little ones
Who are faint because of hunger
At the head of every street.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, O Lord, and look!
With whom have You dealt thus?
Should women eat their offspring,
The little ones who were born healthy?
Should priest and prophet be slain
In the sanctuary of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the ground in the streets
Lie young and old;
My virgins and my young men
Have fallen by the sword.
You have slain them in the day of Your anger,
You have slaughtered, not sparing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You called as in the day of an appointed feast
My terrors on every side;
And there was no one who escaped or survived
In the day of the Lord’s anger.
Those whom I bore and reared,
My enemy annihilated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the man who has seen affliction
Because of the rod of His wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has driven me and made me walk
In darkness and not in light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely against me He has turned His hand
Repeatedly all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has caused my flesh and my skin to waste away,
He has broken my bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has besieged and encompassed me with bitterness and hardship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In dark places He has made me dwell,
Like those who have long been dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has walled me in so that I cannot go out;
He has made my chain heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when I cry out and call for help,
He shuts out my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has blocked my ways with hewn stone;
He has made my paths crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is to me like a bear lying in wait,
Like a lion in secret places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has turned aside my ways and torn me to pieces;
He has made me desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He bent His bow
And set me as a target for the arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made the arrows of His quiver
To enter into my inward parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a laughingstock to all my people,
Their mocking song all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled me with bitterness,
He has made me drunk with wormwood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has broken my teeth with gravel;
He has made me cower in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul has been rejected from peace;
I have forgotten happiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I say, “My strength has perished,
And so has my hope from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember my affliction and my wandering, the wormwood and bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely my soul remembers
And is bowed down within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This I recall to my mind,
Therefore I have hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s lovingkindnesses indeed never cease,
For His compassions never fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are new every morning;
Great is Your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord is my portion,” says my soul,
“Therefore I have hope in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is good to those who wait for Him,
To the person who seeks Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good that he waits silently
For the salvation of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for a man that he should bear
The yoke in his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him sit alone and be silent
Since He has laid it on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him put his mouth in the dust,
Perhaps there is hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him give his cheek to the smiter,
Let him be filled with reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will not reject forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For if He causes grief,
Then He will have compassion
According to His abundant lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For He does not afflict willingly
Or grieve the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To crush under His feet
All the prisoners of the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To deprive a man of justice
In the presence of the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To defraud a man in his lawsuit—
Of these things the Lord does not approve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is there who speaks and it comes to pass,
Unless the Lord has commanded it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not from the mouth of the Most High
That both good and ill go forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should any living mortal, or any man,
Offer complaint in view of his sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us examine and probe our ways,
And let us return to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We lift up our heart and hands
Toward God in heaven;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have transgressed and rebelled,
You have not pardoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have covered Yourself with a cloud
So that no prayer can pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us mere offscouring and refuse
In the midst of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Panic and pitfall have befallen us,
Devastation and destruction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes run down with streams of water
Because of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes pour down unceasingly,
Without stopping,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Until the Lord looks down
And sees from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes bring pain to my soul
Because of all the daughters of my city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies without cause
Hunted me down like a bird;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have silenced me in the pit
And have placed a stone on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Waters flowed over my head;
I said, “I am cut off!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I called on Your name, O Lord,
Out of the lowest pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have heard my voice,
“Do not hide Your ear from my prayer for relief,
From my cry for help.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You drew near when I called on You;
You said, “Do not fear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, You have pleaded my soul’s cause;
You have redeemed my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, You have seen my oppression;
Judge my case.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen all their vengeance,
All their schemes against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have heard their reproach, O Lord,
All their schemes against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of my assailants and their whispering
Are against me all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on their sitting and their rising;
I am their mocking song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will recompense them, O Lord,
According to the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will give them hardness of heart,
Your curse will be on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will pursue them in anger and destroy them
From under the heavens of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How dark the gold has become,
How the pure gold has changed!
The sacred stones are poured out
At the corner of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The precious sons of Zion,
Weighed against fine gold,
How they are regarded as earthen jars,
The work of a potter’s hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even jackals offer the breast,
They nurse their young;
But the daughter of my people has become cruel
Like ostriches in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the infant cleaves
To the roof of its mouth because of thirst;
The little ones ask for bread,
But no one breaks it for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who ate delicacies
Are desolate in the streets;
Those reared in purple
Embrace ash pits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the iniquity of the daughter of my people
Is greater than the sin of Sodom,
Which was overthrown as in a moment,
And no hands were turned toward her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her consecrated ones were purer than snow,
They were whiter than milk;
They were more ruddy in body than corals,
Their polishing was like lapis lazuli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their appearance is blacker than soot,
They are not recognized in the streets;
Their skin is shriveled on their bones,
It is withered, it has become like wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better are those slain with the sword
Than those slain with hunger;
For they pine away, being stricken
For lack of the fruits of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hands of compassionate women
Boiled their own children;
They became food for them
Because of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has accomplished His wrath,
He has poured out His fierce anger;
And He has kindled a fire in Zion
Which has consumed its foundations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth did not believe,
Nor did any of the inhabitants of the world,
That the adversary and the enemy
Could enter the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the sins of her prophets
And the iniquities of her priests,
Who have shed in her midst
The blood of the righteous;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Depart! Unclean!” they cried of themselves.
“Depart, depart, do not touch!”
So they fled and wandered;
Men among the nations said,
“They shall not continue to dwell with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The presence of the Lord has scattered them,
He will not continue to regard them;
They did not honor the priests,
They did not favor the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet our eyes failed,
Looking for help was useless;
In our watching we have watched
For a nation that could not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They hunted our steps
So that we could not walk in our streets;
Our end drew near,
Our days were finished
For our end had come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our pursuers were swifter
Than the eagles of the sky;
They chased us on the mountains,
They waited in ambush for us in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The breath of our nostrils, the Lord’s anointed,
Was captured in their pits,
Of whom we had said, “Under his shadow
We shall live among the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,
Who dwells in the land of Uz;
But the cup will come around to you as well,
You will become drunk and make yourself naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Lord, what has befallen us;
Look, and see our reproach!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers,
Our houses to aliens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become orphans without a father,
Our mothers are like widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have to pay for our drinking water,
Our wood comes to us at a price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our pursuers are at our necks;
We are worn out, there is no rest for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have submitted to Egypt and Assyria to get enough bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our fathers sinned, and are no more;
It is we who have borne their iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Slaves rule over us;
There is no one to deliver us from their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We get our bread at the risk of our lives
Because of the sword in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our skin has become as hot as an oven,
Because of the burning heat of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They ravished the women in Zion,
The virgins in the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes were hung by their hands;
Elders were not respected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Young men worked at the grinding mill,
And youths stumbled under loads of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elders are gone from the gate,
Young men from their music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The joy of our hearts has ceased;
Our dancing has been turned into mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown has fallen from our head;
Woe to us, for we have sinned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of this our heart is faint,
Because of these things our eyes are dim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of Mount Zion which lies desolate,
Foxes prowl in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, O Lord, rule forever;
Your throne is from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You forget us forever?
Why do You forsake us so long?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us to You, O Lord, that we may be restored;
Renew our days as of old,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless You have utterly rejected us
And are exceedingly angry with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
